[H1] Case: A 3 year old boy is brought to the emergency department.
[LIST_ITEM] CC: a productive cough, fever (temp 102.1 C), and headache.
[LIST_ITEM] PEx: healthy boy with rales present on auscultation of the left lower chest.
[LIST_ITEM] CxR: intra-alveolar infiltrate in the left lower lobe.

[LIST_ITEM] Hx: mother reports multiple episodes (approx. 5 per year) of recurrent bacterial infections including otitis media, sinusitis, pneumonia, and purulent skin lesions. These infections usually responded to antibiotic treatment.
List three different mechanisms that could account for this patient's increased susceptibility to bacterial infection:
